Description:
Our client is an ambitious and fast-growing FMCG products distribution, manufacturing and B2B ecommerce company that connects suppliers with retailers worldwide.As a part of their business expansion to Middle East region, they are setting up a regional office in Dubai and looking for a Talent Acquisition Head. This role offers a unique opportunity to build a high-performing team, shape our talent acquisition strategy, and contribute significantly to our company's growth and success.Key Responsibilities:Strategic Planning: Develop and execute a comprehensive talent acquisition strategy aligned with our regional expansion goals.
Team Leadership: Build and lead a talented team of recruiters and HR professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, growth, and excellence.
Recruitment Process: Oversee end-to-end recruitment processes, from sourcing and screening to offer management and onboarding, ensuring a seamless candidate experience.
Partnerships: Establish and nurture strong partnerships with internal stakeholders to understand hiring needs and priorities.
Employer Branding: Enhance our employer brand in the market, positioning [Your Company Name] as an employer of choice in the FMCG sector.
Diversity and Inclusion: Drive diversity and inclusion initiatives to ensure a diverse and inclusive workforce.
Metrics and Reporting: Implement and analyze key recruitment metrics to continuously improve and optimize the hiring process.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with regional labor laws, regulations, and company policies throughout the recruitment processSkills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
Proven experience in talent acquisition leadership, ideally within the FMCG or related industries.
Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, including sourcing strategies, interview techniques, and onboarding processes.
Exceptional leadership and team-building skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Results-driven mindset with a focus on data and analytics.
Experience with applicant tracking systems and HR technology.
Familiarity with regional labor laws and regulations.
